meanings.definition: Leave a ship, aircraft, or other vehicle.
meanings.sent1: Passengers must disembark the plane after it lands.
meanings.sent2: We will disembark the cruise ship once we reach the port.
meanings.sent3: The penguins decided to disembark the iceberg and explore the ocean.
meanings.sent4: After a long journey, it was time for the thoughts to disembark the mind.
meanings.sent5: The idea to disembark the project seemed daunting but necessary.

meanings.definition: To go ashore from a ship.
meanings.sent1: Tourists will disembark the ferry to explore the island.
meanings.sent2: The sailors will disembark the warship when they reach the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The dolphins playfully tried to disembark the submarine in the movie.
meanings.sent4: As the relationship sailed on troubled waters, it was time to disembark.
meanings.sent5: The decision to disembark the comfort of routine was both scary and exciting.
